definition: Rehe, Qing dynasty province abolished in 1955 and divided among Hebei, Liaoning and Inner Mongolia/refers to the Qing imperial resort at Chengde/see also 避暑山莊|避暑山庄[bi4 shu3 shan1 zhuang1] (history)
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: The Mongolian nationality was one of the main nationalities in Rehe area.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古族是熱河地區主要民族之一。

sentences.english: In the northeast corner, located Qing spring, it is the famous Rehe spring.
sentences.chinese: 東北角有清泉，即著名的熱河泉。

sentences.english: The former Rehe Province was one of the provinces where the I-Kuan Tao (the Unity Sect) ran rampant in the pro-liberation days.
sentences.chinese: 熱河省是建國前一貫道活動最爲猖獗的省份之一。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
horse thief/(old) group of horse-mounted bandits
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
